title: Pete Hegseth
added: In early August 2019 and 2020, Hegseth swam across the [[Hudson River]] with [[United States Navy SEAL|Navy SEAL]]s in support of military veterans.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.foxnews.com/media/pete-hegseth-navy-seals-hudson-swim |title=Pete Hegseth, Navy SEALs swim across Hudson River to honor military vets |date=August 3, 2019 |first=Sam |last=Dorman |publisher=Fox News |access-date=October 3, 2019 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.yahoo.com/pete-hegseth-swims-navy-seals-143046835.html |title=Pete Hegseth swims with Navy Seals to honor veterans |date=August 8, 2020 |work=Fox News |via=Yahoo News |access-date=December 7, 2020 }}</ref>

title: Pete Hegseth
deleted: In February 2019, Hegseth joked on ''[[Fox & Friends]]'' that he didn't think he had washed his hands in ten years. He explained: "I inoculate myself. Germs are not a real thing. I can't see them, therefore they're not real."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wolfson |first1=Sam |title='Germs are not a real thing': Fox News host says he hasn't washed hands in 10 years |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2019/feb/11/germs-are-not-real-fox-news-host-pete-hegseth |work=The Guardian |date=11 February 2019}}</ref> Hegseth addressed the comment, which received much attention on [[Twitter]], clarifying that he was joking, saying: "My half-hearted commentary to the point is, we live in a society where people walk around with bottles of Purell in their pockets, and they sanitize 19,000 times a day as if that's going to save their life".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tobin |first1=Ben |title=Fox News host Pete Hegseth comes clean? I do wash my hands |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/02/11/fox-news-host-pete-hegseth-wash-hands-10-years/2835616002/ |work=USA Today |date=11 February 2019}}</ref>
